nl.tue.geometrycore.util

Class Interval

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.geometrycore.util.Interval

  • public class Interval
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a closed interval on the real domain. Empty intervals are represented by a maximum that is strictly lower than the configured minimum.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Interval()
      Creates an empty interval.
      Interval(double... values)
      Creates the smallest interval containing all specified values.
      Interval(double value)
      Creates a singleton interval.
      Interval(double min, double max)
      Creates an arbitrary interval, based on the minimum and maximum value.
      Interval(Interval clone)
      Clones the given interval.

        public Interval(Interval clone)
        Clones the given interval.

      • Interval

        public Interval()
        Creates an empty interval.

      • Interval

        public Interval(double value)
        Creates a singleton interval.
        Parameters:
        value - the single value

      • Interval

        public Interval(double min,
                double max)
        Creates an arbitrary interval, based on the minimum and maximum value. Note that setting min greater than max yields an empty interval.
        Parameters:
        min - lower bound on the interval
        max - upper bound on the interval

      • Interval

        public Interval(double... values)
        Creates the smallest interval containing all specified values.
        Parameters:
        values - values to be contained by the interval

    • Method Detail

      • union

        public static Interval union(Interval... intervals)
        Constructs the interval that represents the union of the provided intervals. Note that any gaps between the provided intervals will also be included in the resulting interval.
        Parameters:
        intervals - intervals to compute the union of
        Returns:
        union of the provided intervals

      • intersection

        public static Interval intersection(Interval... intervals)
        Constructs the interval that represents the intersection of the provided intervals.
        Parameters:
        intervals - intervals to compute the intersection of
        Returns:
        intersection of the provided intervals

      • setMin

        public void setMin(double min)

      • setMax

        public void setMax(double max)

      • getMin

        public double getMin()

      • getMax

        public double getMax()

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Tests if the interval is empty, with a precision of DoubleUtil.EPS.
        Returns:
        maximum < minimum - EPS

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty(double prec)
        Tests if the interval is empty, with a specified precision.
        Parameters:
        prec - precision
        Returns:
        maximum < minimum - prec

      • isSingleton

        public boolean isSingleton()
        Tests for a singleton interval, with a precision of DoubleUtil.EPS. Note that it also returns true for empty intervals.
        Returns:
        maximum < minimum + EPS

      • isSingleton

        public boolean isSingleton(double prec)
        Tests for a singleton interval, with a specified precision. Note that it also returns true for empty intervals.
        Parameters:
        prec - precision
        Returns:
        maximum < minimum + prec

      • length

        public double length()
        Computes the length of the interval. Note that both singleton and empty intervals have a length of 0.
        Returns:
        maximum - minimum

      • mean

        public double mean()
        Returns the mean value of the interval. NaN will be returned for empty intervals.
        Returns:
        (min + max) / 2

      • contains

        public boolean contains(double value)
        Tests whether a given value is contained in the interval, with a precision of DoubleUtil.EPS.
        Parameters:
        value - value to test for
        Returns:
        value in [minimum-EPS, maximum+EPS]

      • contains

        public boolean contains(double value,
                        double prec)
        Tests whether a given value is contained in the interval, with a specified precision.
        Parameters:
        value - value to test for
        prec - precision
        Returns:
        value in [minimum-prec, maximum+prec]

      • random

        public double random()
        Generates a random number contained in the interval. NaN will be returned for empty intervals.
        Returns:
        random number in [minimum,maximum)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • scale

        public void scale(double factor)
        Scales the interval around its mean value. Has no effect on empty intervals.
        Parameters:
        factor - factor to increase the length by

      • scale

        public void scale(double factor,
                  double center)
        Scales the interval around the provided center value.
        Parameters:
        factor - factor to increase the length by
        center - central value for scaling

      • shift

        public void shift(double shift)
        Shifts the interval, increasing both minimum and maximum by the same amount. Has no effect on empty intervals.
        Parameters:
        shift - desired increase
